lines.text: "The Steakhouse." Well, we can only hope the imagination saved coming up with the name is being put to good use in the kitchen!

I made reservations at a wonderful new French resturaunt on Broome Street, everyone is raving about it. A friend of mine was there last week. One of the waiters slapped her face. It's like you're in Provence!
It was a fling. It was meaningless; like two ships passing in the night.
Except they didn't just pass, did they Chelsea? They docked and some of the passengers got off!
Jane, when I need to feel good about myself, I look inside of me. And you know something, I'm always there for me. You need to do that. When I need approval, do you know what I do? I look to me.
I am. Now, what are you going to do from now on?
When I need approval, I'm gonna look to me.
Uh, no. Jane, Jane, that's not what I said. You're gonna look to ME! You have to listen!
Well, I don't remember all the details. Uh, he came over, we talked, we had some wine, we did it and then he left. How was the rest of your evening?
How was the rest of your---
No, go back. You did it? What do you mean "it?"
Well, I think it's the only "it" there is. Isn't it?
